medical_history.chief_complaint: Pain and decreased hearing in the left ear.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 6 weeks before presentation, starting with decreased hearing, discomfort, and a sensation of blockage in the left ear. Symptoms improved briefly with treatment but recurred with worsening pain, prompting the visit to the emergency department.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Essential thrombocythemia diagnosed 18 years ago, treated with interferon alfa and hydroxyurea; complicated by anemia requiring intermittent transfusions. Patient also has hypertension, anxiety, chronic diarrhea, and mild renal insufficiency. Allergy to hydroxychloroquine sulfate.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had diabetes mellitus, hepatic and renal disease, and breast cancer; father had heart disease and hypertension; siblings and child are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Married, worked in a healthcare facility, currently works in an office, traveled to Europe, the Mediterranean, China, and the Caribbean. Does not drink alcohol, smoke, or use illicit drugs.
